image.altText: Little boy, little girl and their mum hug with Christmas tree in background

props.synopsis: When seven-month-old Evelyn was diagnosed with a rare cancer, her mother was told proton beam therapy would be her daughter's best chance for survival. But the treatment was not available in Australia and still is not three years later.

title.children: Parents, cancer patients say lack of proton therapy 'an embarrassment'

image.altText: A fence out the front of a prison that says Yatala Labour Prison.

props.synopsis: In sentencing, the South Australian District Court judge said Paul Andrew Robinson's offending was motivated by an "ultimate aim to make a lot of money".

title.children: Correctional services executive jailed over $300k prison rort

image.altText: A fire truck roof in the foreground with fires around at night

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old who had been a cadet captain in the Country Fire Service admits deliberately lighting a bushfire near Naracoorte, but mental health conditions lower the sentence he might otherwise have been given.

title.children: Volunteer firefighter sentenced for intentionally starting SA bushfire

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt and bandana standing next to his yellow Vespa scooter.

props.synopsis: One man, one little yellow Vespa and a 12,000-kilometre road trip to attend every Ashes Test.

title.children: Cricket fanatic crisscrossing Australia on Vespa to attend every Ashes Test

image.altText: A man in blue shirt in front of a new headstone and a red flower wreath next to older graves

props.synopsis: South Australian high school students have helped to uncover the legacies of five war veterans who were laid to rest in unmarked graves.

title.children: Students help uncover forgotten stories of WWI veterans and nurses

image.altText: A firefighter with a fire hose sprays a smouldering tree stump.

props.synopsis: The CFS is warning of high fire risk tomorrow with hot and windy conditions forecast, while the BOM has issued a fire weather warning with 'extreme fire danger' for parts of the state.

title.children: 'Extreme fire danger' forecast across South Australia for Thursday

image.altText: A public health official at a parliamentary inquiry.

props.synopsis: South Australia's public health chief says there is a need for more data analysis to determine whether there has been an increase in respiratory illness linked to the state's algal bloom.

title.children: Algal inquiry quizzes health chief about respiratory illness

image.altText: The Elizabeth City Centre shopping centre during a lockdown.

props.synopsis: The Elizabeth City Centre shopping centre was placed in lockdown with shoppers evacuated on Friday afternoon after an alleged fight that left two males with "critical" and "life-threatening" injuries.

title.children: Fourth person arrested over Adelaide shopping centre stabbing

image.altText: A man wearing a black leather jacket and black head covering stands in front of a stone wall with a motorcycle attached to it.

props.synopsis: Motorcyclists in regional SA and south-west Victoria say pothole-riddled regional roads are taking a physical, mental and financial toll on riders.

title.children: Fed up motorcyclists call for dangerous potholes littering highways to be fixed

image.altText: A young, dark-haired girl in a school uniform doing some colouring-in at a desk.

props.synopsis: A former neighbour of a mother standing trial accused of criminally neglecting her daughter tried to report concerns to an abuse line, but her call went unanswered, a court has heard.

title.children: Neighbour of manslaughter-accused mother heard 'loud screaming', court hears

image.altText: A supermarket fresh food aisle

props.synopsis: Beekeepers say the escalating cost of pollinating crops will be passed onto consumers as the industry battles a devastating bee killer.

title.children: Shoppers warned of grocery price rise as parasite hits crop production

image.altText: A tall white column with a bright light at the top in front of a blue sky, with silver piping underneath.

props.synopsis: The long-awaited decision for a Northern Water project has arrived — but it has come with environmental contention.

title.children: Flag planted for Upper Eyre's proposed $5 billion desalination plant

image.altText: Darren Letton holds a chicken. He wears a navy and yellow polo shirt. He is standing in a chicken barn.

props.synopsis: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

title.children: Egg shortage becomes egg oversupply with farmers unable to sell product

image.altText: Ted Egan smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Folk music legend, author and former Northern Territory administrator Ted Egan has died aged 93.

title.children: Former NT administrator, musician and author Ted Egan dies aged 93

image.altText: A room with a dentist chair is surrounded by masks of men on the wall

props.synopsis: Democrats say the newly released images provide a "harrowing look" into Jeffrey Epstein's world, as the late sex offender's jailed accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell, informs a court she is planning to challenge her imprisonment.

title.children: Images of Epstein's island released as Maxwell flags bid for freedom

image.altText: An old woman and man, both wearing glasses, sit on chairs around a round wooden table

props.synopsis: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police will not pay for an expert report.

title.children: Fresh probe into Lisa Lynn's death stalls over $9,000 bill, family says

image.altText: A man wearing dark sunglasses and a black jacket

props.synopsis: The South African neo-Nazi who sparked controversy during a protest outside NSW parliament has left Australia after his visa was revoked.

title.children: Neo-Nazi and family leave country after minister revoked visa

image.altText: A heavily damaged house surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's government says it will summon eight companies over their suspected role in worsening the scale of floods and landslides that have killed over 700 people. But environmental groups say authorities are hypocritical and partly to blame for the destruction.

title.children: Palm oil, mining blamed for cyclone devastation in Sumatra

image.altText: A digitally blended composite image comprised of people and the RBA

props.synopsis: A leading economist says the "risk" of an "imminent" RBA interest rate hike is "rising", while former treasurer Peter Costello is urging Australia to arrest its fertility downturn. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Risk of 'imminent' RBA rate hike rising

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Market expects September RBA rate hike but it could be sooner
Bitcoin losing street cred? Analysis by Ian Verrender

image.altText: Richard Marles and Pat Conroy press conference

props.synopsis: The acting prime minister says the United States is fully supportive of AUKUS and has thanked it for providing a review. Follow live.

title.children: Marles says he is 'working through' AUKUS review from the US

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The state and territory housing scorecard
Childcare 'spot checks' at 40 so far but 1,000 to come
Should Australia have backed up its 'mate' Japan in its China stand-off?

image.altText: Aerial shot of cars

props.synopsis: A man charged with murder is refused bail as another faces extradition over a shooting on the NSW North Coast that left one man dead and two others injured.

title.children: Second man set to be charged with murder over Northern Rivers shooting

image.altText: A composite of Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: After a flurry of meetings, Russia's war in Ukraine continues. So where is the peace process at?

title.children: Here's what experts say about the Russia–Ukraine peace process

image.altText: Medicine blister packs on a red surface.

props.synopsis: Health experts say tighter regulations around pregnancy supplements are needed as newer brands replace folic acid — a key nutrient shown to prevent birth defects — with a lesser-studied alternative.

title.children: What's in pregnancy supplements? Sorting science from marketing spin

image.altText: A raccoon is seen passed out on a bathroom floor, in between a black bin and a white toilet.

props.synopsis: The suspect broke into a liquor store in the US state of Virginia, ransacked several shelves and ended up face down in the bathroom.

title.children: Raccoon goes on liquor binge and passes out in toilet

image.altText: Travis Head looks over his shoulder as he completes a shot.

props.synopsis: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: What time does the Gabba Test start and everything else you need to know

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: A report by the Pentagon watchdog concludes US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated Pentagon policy by using his personal device for official business and recommends better training for all Pentagon officials.

title.children: Hegseth's use of Signal app posed risk to US personnel, watchdog finds

image.altText: A pencil drawing of a man surrounded by a vortex of redress scheme forms

props.synopsis: An independent audit of the National Redress Scheme has found wait times are increasing and causing significant distress to survivors of child sexual abuse.

title.children: Child sexual abuse victims face anxious wait for redress via official scheme

image.altText: Black and white image of Jimmy Barnes in a white singlet in an open space staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cold Chisel was over. America beckoned. And Jimmy Barnes was terrified. This is the story of the album that made him, and the song that saved him.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes's American gamble didn't pay off — but he has no regrets

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks away as a TV camera films him.

props.synopsis: With his defamation appeal dismissed and legal costs rising, Bruce Lehrmann is almost out of options. A High Court bid is possible, but what would it take to get there?

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann is running out of courts to continue his legal battle

image.altText: A group of wind turbines dotted along a hillside against a hazy blue sky

props.synopsis: An energy watchdog says more renewable energy is projected to lower prices, but others warn the promise is illusory and more pain is coming.

title.children: Watchdog flags 5 per cent fall in power prices amid renewables surge

image.altText: A Shanghai arena sits deserted as Japanese cultural events face sudden cancellations.

props.synopsis: Beijing halts more than 20 Japanese cultural events across China as its diplomatic spat with Japan escalates.

title.children: Japan's pop queen sings to 14,000 empty seats amid Beijing crackdown

image.altText: aa middle aged man with greying hair and glasses

props.synopsis: A California doctor is imprisoned for illegally supplying Friends sitcom star Matthew Perry with ketamine, the powerful sedative that caused the actor's drug overdose death in 2023.

title.children: Doctor in Matthew Perry overdose case jailed

image.altText: A large bronze sculpture of a gorilla that has been installed in a park.

props.synopsis: A statue of a 30-year-old eastern lowland gorilla named Mina is one of 22 donated to Eurobodalla Shire Council by internationally recognised artists Gillie and Marc.

title.children: $1.6m art installation, including 3-metre gorilla, gets town talking

image.altText: A close up photo of Jaclyn Symes with a red background

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jaclyn Symes says the state's public service has become "top-heavy" with "too many executives", as her government unveils measures to save $4 billion over the next four years.

title.children: Victorian government targets executives as 1,000 public sector jobs cut

image.altText: Hong Kong fire

props.synopsis: Authorities are continuing to probe the blaze at the Wang Fuk Court complex, which killed at least 159 people last week.

title.children: Six people arrested for deactivating fire alarms at Hong Kong fire site
